description: From Latin nauseōsus (“causing nausea”), corresponding synchronically to nausea +‎ -ous.

adjectives.description: nauseous (comparative more nauseous, superlative most nauseous)

entries.meaning: Causing nausea; sickening or disgusting. [from 17th c.]
examples: [T]he Italians grossness of Conversation is still very offensive & nauseous, tho' long accustomed to it.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Inclined to nausea; sickly, squeamish. [17th c.]
(sometimes proscribed) Afflicted with nausea; sick. [from 19th c.]
examples: After he had scarcely eaten enough, he felt nauseous; but nausea ceased as soon as he stopped eating entirely, …
